economic_impact: Testimony provided by Hawaii Pyrotechnics and Explosives LLC indicates that the bill, as originally written, would severely impact the ability of professional, licensed fireworks companies to operate, potentially disrupting community events and large-scale productions (HB1483_TESTIMONY_JHA_02-06-25_). This testimony highlights a potential negative economic impact on a local business by unintentionally restricting legally permitted operations (HB1483_TESTIMONY_JHA_02-06-25_). Amendments were requested to ensure professional licensed fireworks productions are properly categorized and allowed to continue operating legally (HB1483_TESTIMONY_JHA_02-06-25_).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: New information is provided through detailed testimony from multiple state agencies and private entities. The Department of the Attorney General and the Department of Law Enforcement testified in strong support, noting that current laws create roadblocks to effective prosecution and enforcement (HB1483_TESTIMONY_JHA_02-06-25_). Opposition testimony from Hawaii Pyrotechnics and Explosives LLC raised concerns about the bill's negative economic impact on licensed, professional fireworks companies (HB1483_TESTIMONY_JHA_02-06-25_). The House Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs subsequently amended the bill (HB1483_HD1) to clarify definitions and penalties, and restored the authority of law enforcement officers to conduct inspections, addressing a specific concern raised in testimony by the Department of Law Enforcement (HB1483_HD1_HSCR629_).
